page.title: 12STOKE PARK HOSPITAL.
page.content: {STOKE PARK}IS A HOSPITAL FOR MENTALLY HANDICAPPED PATIENTS. THE OLDEST BUILDING, THE DOWER HOUSE, WAS BUILT IN 1805 BY THE DUKE OF BEAUFORT FOR HIS MOTHER. THIS, AND THE OTHER BUILDINGS, WERE OPENED AS A HOSPITAL IN 1917, AND HAVE BEEN EXTENDED OVER THE YEARS. THERE ARE 444 PATIENTS, MEN AND WOMEN, THE YOUNGEST OF WHOM IS ELEVEN. THERE ARE 23 WARDS, WITH BETWEEN 8 AND 25 PATIENTS COMPARED WITH 120 PER WARD IN THE EARLY DAYS.SOME OF THE PATIENTS HAVE BEEN THERE FOR OVER 50 YEARS. VERY FEW PATIENTS ARE NOW ADMITTED BECAUSE THE POLICY IS TO LOOK AFTER THE MENTALLY HANDICAPPED WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AS FAR AS POSSIBLE. INSTEAD THE HOSPITAL TAKES IN A LOT OF SHORT-STAY PATIENTS WHO COME FOR A WEEKEND OR A WEEK WHILE THEIR PARENTS HAVE A REST OR GO ON HOLIDAY.
